channel.title: Buzzing on Quora
channel.description: 用中文浏览Quora上的热门回答

item.title: What are the benefits of an easy, flexible, three-step tool for making decisions? @MichelleSegar PhD, author of The Joy Choice, shares her expertise. https://t.co/7jEMJybOtN https://t.co/OOyTIF5KW1

Ever wondered what it's like to work at Quora? Check out this @builtin profile of senior leadership, find out what makes Quora special, and get a little glimpse of what the future holds! https://t.co/snV7PHvm3A
When is the sun like caramel corn? Physics teacher and Quora contributor Philip Freeman explains it's all about the H-alpha filter: https://t.co/q10rtvPWQ4 https://t.co/HqLOXA5EP5
How did sunflowers, a new-world plant domesticated by Native Americans, become one of the main agricultural products of Ukraine? It's a bit of a Johnny Appleseed story! https://t.co/F0r5KKPsPj
Who is the victim in the Amber Heard v. Johnny Depp trial? @NeamaRahmani, President of @WestCoastTrial answers. https://t.co/qYf2PveCJb https://t.co/vDpZgs0Hoj

In a time of war, is there any progress in the global movement toward peace as a norm? Emma Varvaloucas (@heyemmavarv), host of What Could Go Right? podcast explains why we should hold some optimism. https://t.co/MF343g7dsY https://t.co/4jWE1e6Q7c
Is job hopping seen as good or bad by employers? @CWaltersPhD, business & branding mentor, corporate training, shares her expert advice. https://t.co/zrZKCUXpmU https://t.co/hjZzDfBs6o

Why are there so many people who are food insecure? Jack Griffin, Founder and CEO of @FoodFinderUS, shares how current events have made food insecurities even worse. https://t.co/a1tRbt2Thf https://t.co/SRZhiM2DwJ

Why do habits created for healthy eating and exercise often fail when real life gets in the way? Answer by @MichelleSegar PhD, author of The Joy Choice. https://t.co/1zLisQJvGf https://t.co/cvXwIClRrx

How has climate change impacted the snowpack and snowfall processes? Andrew Schwartz (@snow_d0c), Atmospheric scientist specializing in snow @UCBerkeley, Lead Scientist at UC Berkeley Central Sierra Snow Laboratory, gives his expert take. https://t.co/4byt1n85pU https://t.co/Wki41xYxXK

Quora contributor and whiskey drinker Jason Almendra posits an interesting theory for why whiskey was stored in charred barrels: the charcoal absorbs any residual methanol. Plausible? https://t.co/eyBhVEf1mC
Quora contributor and world-traveler Peter Wade says Hungary is the Alabama of Europe. Agree or disagree? https://t.co/1JaVytd1b8
People are wondering what the war in #Ukraine means for #Taiwan. Experts on Quora think it doesn't change the odds but the odds jumped 15% on @metaculus. Who is right? https://t.co/g2SlRfyNEU

Ever wondered what cursive Cyrillic looks like? We did! Here's Brian Collins, Slavic linguist, with a beautiful answer on cursive forms of various languages: https://t.co/JHmYcM2oVh https://t.co/nE0ZOhxA3Q
What do psychologists think of Jordan Peterson as a therapist? https://t.co/g1TyMdVA7S
You might not ever need to polish out scuff marks from the gleaming exterior of Air Force One, but isn't it cool that someone knows how? https://t.co/CDfe1IY750 https://t.co/ttAGwvC8va

How can you hack the hiring process to get the job I really want? Former Bachelorette contestant and author of 'Restart Roadmap', @Jason_Tartick, shares his best advice. https://t.co/TuPr9dw39m https://t.co/O66DVvfM74
When should you hire a personal injury lawyer? @NeamaRahmani President of @WestCoastTrial, explains when it's important to consult a legal expert. https://t.co/eQO99JYCMf https://t.co/YKPED1zE6B

How is it possible that, after all that Ferdinand and Imelda Marcos did throughout their political history, their son Bongbong Marcos is now about to win the presidency in the Philippines? Quora contributor Jean-Marie Valheur summarizes: https://t.co/wynqYj4xxB
How can workplaces better prevent staff burnout? Answer by Global President at @deputyapp. https://t.co/6KYYZXc3OU https://t.co/nVh11RAvO7
What is the women peace and security (WPS) agenda? @_Nisha_Singh, Global Policy and Advocacy Manager at @womenforwomenUK and @WomenforWomen, explains. https://t.co/f9aalIppgY https://t.co/n0PjKE5IaW
How does @Writefullapp use AI to help with academic writing? See their answer here: https://t.co/QhomTtJh7z https://t.co/be0F6oS6qx
What kinds of services does @WeatherWorks offer? You'd be surprised! https://t.co/7582CydL3y https://t.co/5UkSrppoGO

Why is it important to flip the fertility script away from a solely female perspective? Khaled Kteily (@kkteily), CEO of @legacy, shares why we should consider all sides. https://t.co/tQL5dMneqJ https://t.co/dhVlFofLwx
Are Amber Heard's lawyers particularly bad, or is this just how trials normally are? @NeamaRahmani, President of @WestCoastTrial, gives his take. https://t.co/oXZ0Cl3xTq https://t.co/SJsGfmTOJc
How did Mariupol get its name? Greek linguists and historians explain the connection to Catherine the Great: https://t.co/1cdpylqA8Y
What do lawyers think about #RoeVWade? A very illuminating discussion (and don't skip the comments!) https://t.co/bc4L1UNxfb

True professionals don't just answer the question that was asked, they answer what the asker meant. Optical engineer Bill Otto demonstrates in his answer to "How far has the light from our Sun made it?" https://t.co/cqDcsTClNW

With organizations starting to reopen offices, what are the best practices to ensure consistency, avoid confusion, and keep employees happy? Chief HR Legal Expert, Kara Govro, shares advice. https://t.co/ZBQg0k9MkA https://t.co/TiZQBYxEgp

What are some gap year programs to consider before college? Founder and CEO of @moon_prep, personalized application guidance, Kristen Moon, shares her best advice. https://t.co/K8kiTVVp06 https://t.co/kOX5csjcfQ
How can managers build trust with their employees? Answer by Global President at @deputyapp. https://t.co/veXnQbjL0i https://t.co/KOGhFEAgTv
Will Amber Heard survive her defamation trial? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial, @NeamaRahmani, shares his insights. https://t.co/PytxcwsJEh https://t.co/o06gnVoo0k
Have you ever tried Surströmming? What foods or culinary habits are unusual in your part of the world? https://t.co/C7C5lc84EQ https://t.co/vFcYtMwAvU
What color were the dinosaurs? https://t.co/Fxdu6pHsnO A simple question with a surprisingly complex answer! https://t.co/K0tnKfB2Cd
What's your next move, now that Twitter has been bought by Elon Musk?
What are the limitations of the duties of directors? Answer by filmmaker and Northwestern film professor, Clayton Brown. https://t.co/R1MnBK2ckk https://t.co/IpoAMd1eCR
How do I turn a personal passion into a social outlet and have longevity? Answer by @lawrencekosick, president and co-founder of @GetSetUp_org. https://t.co/5nB2nnRRmn https://t.co/M3afJXekLa
Why was Turkey the one country Nazi Germany would not invade? An interesting perspective and well-told story! https://t.co/Cgkr85M0FX https://t.co/DiqTadso7w
Where does the speed of light come from? Science writer Brandon Ross offers an intuitive explanation that will leave you with more questions: https://t.co/7HwQ9kKSxy
Why is intersectionality important to social justice? @PauliMurrayCntr, breaks it down. https://t.co/nEthL1Al9Z https://t.co/KCEhNNbNCE

How is personal injury law different from other types of law? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial @NeamaRahmani explains the one main difference. Read about it here: https://t.co/fblq7ydRVo https://t.co/rNDLJKpdhz

What is the easiest way for businesses to reduce their carbon footprint? Hunter Ray Barker (@stuntmanhunter), Co-Founder at @BullfrogAgency, gives three solid strategies. https://t.co/21IZEwEMFH https://t.co/CpI4JMjVLu

What advice would you give to an aspiring lawyer? President and Chief Executive Officer at @WestCoastTrial, @NeamaRahmani, says you need to enjoy two things. Read about them here: https://t.co/GQb3c907JM https://t.co/07BaAh3CyQ
It's the weekend! What is everyone doing? We're reading this enlightening answer about how whiskey ages: https://t.co/thVtib8O5k https://t.co/YpFMLAwGTy
Wondering what Elon Musk's plans are regarding Twitter? Some bright people on Quora read the tea leaves correctly about the takeover. What will their next prediction be? https://t.co/LJDqXSktaN
How smart were the peasants in the middle ages? According to historian Frank Melling, they might be smarter than you think! https://t.co/4WnzBgTqDE https://t.co/ckop1E7g3X

The cleverness of the human species has resulted in such wonderful diversity of architecture. Via the Wonders of the Past Space, we learned about HÓRREOS, a traditional structure on the Iberian peninsula of Spain and Portugal. Can you guess what it's for? https://t.co/dLc4CQsP9n https://t.co/8rZKiVQMhh

Viktor Medvedchuk was recently detained in Ukraine. Who is he and why is this important? To answer the question, we can look at what Ukrainians said about him on Quora prior to the invasion: https://t.co/OSk6ojaHmL
Which kill more birds, wind turbines or office buildings? Quora contributor Michael Barnard does the math: https://t.co/Hs38BXzBdL
Ramadan questions? Quora has you covered: https://t.co/3Ok0DekqPv
